description: Privacy layer for Solana (originally) - now pivoted to ZK Compression Protocol for Solana state reduction

cryptographic_primitives.name: Groth16 SNARK
cryptographic_primitives.purpose: Zero-knowledge proofs for compressed account integrity verification

cryptographic_primitives.name: Poseidon Hash
cryptographic_primitives.purpose: Arithmetic-friendly hash function for Merkle tree construction

cryptographic_primitives.name: Sparse Binary Merkle Tree
cryptographic_primitives.purpose: State tree for compressed account storage
cryptographic_primitives.capacity: 67 million compressed account state transitions per tree

architecture.data_structure: Forest of multiple binary Merkle trees
architecture.state_storage: Compressed account data hashed and stored as Merkle tree leaves
architecture.verification: Small validity proofs verify multiple compressed accounts

v1_privacy_features.description: Shielded pools similar to Zcash/Tornado Cash
features: Break on-chain link between sender and recipient
Shielded internal transactions (conceals amount and recipient)
Optional compliance proofs to re-establish fund origin
v1_privacy_features.status: Legacy version (v1), current focus is ZK Compression

protocol_evolution.pivot: Shifted focus to data compression through zero-knowledge proofs
protocol_evolution.current_focus: ZK Compression Protocol for state reduction and cost optimization

cost_reduction.description: Reduces Solana account storage costs by orders of magnitude
cost_reduction.example: 100-byte PDA reduced from 0.0016 SOL to ~0.00001 SOL

characteristics: Full composability with existing Solana programs

data_quality.research_methodology: Multi-source web search, GitHub repository analysis, official documentation review

notes: Light Protocol has evolved from a privacy-focused protocol (v1) to a ZK compression protocol (current)
The v1 repository (light-protocol-v1) contains the original privacy-focused implementation with shielded pools
Current main repository focuses on ZK Compression for state reduction and cost optimization
Both versions leverage zkSNARKs but for different purposes
Protocol is production-ready with multiple security audits
Supports custom ZK circuits for advanced use cases
All data extracted from official sources - NO synthetic data generated
